Leander ISD is proud to announce Cedar Park Middle School's Reid Vines as the Leander ISD Student-Athlete of the Week. An 8th-grade standout on the Leopard football, basketball and track teams, Reid was a two-way starter on the football team and is quite the leader on the basketball court as well. Reid can also add to his resume that he is a straight-A student and is an active participant in Youth Leadership.

“Reid always has a great attitude," said CPMS Boys Coordinator Brendan McCarthy. "He’s one of the hardest workers on the team. Reid is a great kid to have in athletics and the other athletes look to him as a leader.”

Congratulations to Reid Vines of Cedar Park Middle School, the Leander ISD Student-Athlete of the Week!

post_text: We’re counting down the Top 10 Leander ISD Facebook stories with the most engagement from 2019! Here’s number 5!
shared_text:
Leander ISD is with Tom Glenn.
October 23, 2019 at 12:00 PM ·

Former Leander ISD Superintendent Tom Glenn is being named a 2019 Outstanding Alumni of the College of Education and Human Development at Texas A&M University. He is among seven alumni of the college who will be recognized at an awards ceremony at the Hilton College Station and Conference Center on Nov. 1.

Glenn received his bachelor’s degree in curriculum and instruction in 1973, followed by his master’s in educational administration in 1977. After serving in various roles in school districts in College Station and Leander, Glenn was named superintendent at Leander ISD in 1987, retiring 20 years later.

Glenn’s lasting legacies in Leander include his efforts championing continuous improvement principles in public education. He helped the district develop a reputation for excellence. A testament to his impact at Leander ISD, his namesake, Glenn High School, opened in 2016.

post_text: We’re counting down the Top 10 Leander ISD Facebook stories with the most engagement from 2019! Here’s number 9!
shared_text:
Leander ISD
May 22, 2019 at 4:44 PM ·

A huge congratulations to Canyon Ridge MS 8th-grader Nihar Janga, champion of the 2019 National Geographic Bee!

The National Geographic GeoBee is an annual competition designed to inspire and reward students' curiosity about the world.

Nihar competed against students in grades four through eight from nearly 10,000 schools across the United States. At the National Championship, he represented Texas going up against 53 other GeoBee state champions.

In 2016, Nihar became the youngest winner of the Scripps National Spelling Bee.

#inspireLISD #achieveLISD
National Geographic Education

Leander ISD would like to congratulate Wiley Middle School drama student Erin Leach for being named the Fine Arts Student of the Week. Erin, an advanced theatre student, does a little bit of everything for the drama club, including serving as a member of the UIL Tech Crew.

“Erin is a constant joy to teach in the classroom and on stage,” director Kimberly Wilson said. “She is bright, fun-loving and a true leader. She is always willing to go above and beyond for her classmates and her artistry, and she carries a fierce passion for the arts.”

Congratulations to WMS’ Erin Leach, the Leander ISD Fine Arts Student of the Week!

post_text:
Jackson King, a third-grade student at Cox Elementary, is this week’s #LISDSuperKid. His “superpower” is #5 – Concern for Others.

Jackson’s servant heart and kindness were most evident in a recent interaction with one of his friends.

“At recess Jackson’s friend had his shoe stuck in the soccer net during the game,” Teacher Debbie Slocombe said. “Jackson helped his friend get his shoe unstuck. When he saw the ball approach the goal, he quickly defended the goal and then went straight back to helping his friend.”

Congratulations, Jackson! Thank you for being a shining example for Cox as an LISD Super Kid! #inspireLISD

post_text:
Evelyn Leach is a dedicated volunteer with a passion for students and staff and flair for excellence. She is the PTA president for Laura Welch Bush Elementary and volunteers at all events and in classrooms. In all she does, her ethic is to provide the best.

Evelyn heads up and works alongside other fantastic volunteers at events like Book Fair, Boo Bash, School Store, Spring Carnival, Sprinting Stars, Robotics and Math Pentathlon, just to name a few.

“Evelyn is an amazing PTA president!” Principal Kristine Kline said. “She works tirelessly to strengthen the learning experiences of students, increase family engagement, and support the faculty and staff of LWBE.”

Evelyn sees the need and assists teachers, students and staff members. She has the heart to serve and always does so with joy. On top of helping out at LWBE, Evelyn is also the PTA vice president for Canyon Ridge Middle School.

Because of her unwavering dedication in service to students, Leander ISD recognizes Evelyn Leach as Volunteer of the Week. #inspireLISD Leander ISD Community Relations

post_text:
Cedar Park High School junior Luke Janysek is the Leander ISD Career and Technical Education (CTE) Student of the Week. A Business Information Management student, Luke is racking up Microsoft certifications at a remarkable pace.

Having recently earned three basic Microsoft Office Specialist certifications in Word, Excel and PowerPoint under the guidance of instructor Ladanna Handcox, Luke leveled up by passing the Microsoft Office Word 2016 Expert Certification Test.

“Luke continues to excel in these courses due to his hard work and determination,” Business teacher and DECA advisor Jon Luke said. “This latest certification is a level up from his previous work and is a huge accomplishment.”

Congratulations to Cedar Park High School’s Luke Janysek, the LISD CTE Student of the Week!

post_text:
Leander ISD is proud to announce Wiley Middle School's Sam Steere LISD Student-Athlete of the Week! Sam is an 8th grader on the Coyote football, basketball and track teams. He was an integral part of the WMS District Champion football team both offensively and defensively. Sam not only holds himself to high standards in athletics, but also in the classroom, which has resulted in him making the A/B Honor Roll for the first and second weeks of school.

“When we put Sam in the game we always know that he is going to do everything in his power to help the team be successful," WMS Boys Coordinator Casey Shrader said. "Sam is willing to do the 'tough' things in practice and games that not all athletes are willing to do. Sam is a very selfless player, and always puts the team above individual accolades.”

Congratulations to Sam Steere, of Wiley Middle School, Leander ISD Student-Athlete of the Week!

Natalie Kaewkao, a fifth-grade student at Cox Elementary, is this week’s #LISDSuperKid. Her “superpower” is #5 – Concern for Others but is also known for her Law-Abidance and Civic Duty.

Natalie is constantly helping others. She comes to school prepared to learn every day and gives her best effort.

Her teachers Anna Kelly, Thomas Blevins, and Ashley Ferguson are thrilled to have her in their classes - "She is a prime example of following all 4 'Be's' We are very proud of her!"

Congratulations, Natalie! Thank you for being a shining example for Cox as an LISD Super Kid! #inspireLISD

post_text:
Annie Rodenbeck is a rockstar volunteer at Westside Elementary. She is a co-room parent in teacher Leigh Roberts' classroom.

Rodenbeck helps with homework, art projects, binding books, learning materials and so much more.

"Annie has come up multiple times to do projects with the kids and put together more purposeful dramatic play centers. She has taken things home to cut, assemble and glue so many times," Roberts said. "She has also volunteered to cover lunches."

Because of her unwavering dedication in service to students, Leander ISD recognizes Annie Rodenbeck as Volunteer of the Week. #inspireLISD Leander ISD Community Relations

post_text:
Leander ISD would like to congratulate Leander High School FFA standout Kayla Gillen for being named the LISD Career and Technical (CTE) Student of the Week. Kayla, an IB student, is a Texas State Floral Association Level 1 Floral Design Certified student. The standout junior is now in Advanced Floral working towards her Level 2 Certification. She is hoping to continue her floral career while in college.

“Kayla continuously puts forth excellent effort in all of her assignments and designs,” advisor Janie Pluenneke said. “She has made several arrangements, without instruction, for events and functions here at Leander High School. In addition, Kayla has asked to start a floral service organization in which students who do not want their arrangements they made here at school, be donated to hospice care, memory care, or any other medical/senior service organizations. She continuously volunteers for community service here at the high school using her floral skills. She is a leader and partner in learning when it comes to the other students!”

post_text:
Running Brushy Middle School's Nati Munoz is the LISD Student-Athlete of the Week. Nati is an 8th-grade member of the Lady Cougar volleyball, basketball, track and soccer teams. Somehow she also finds time to be a cheerleader at RBMS! Her leadership skills have earned her multiple captain positions on the various teams, and she also excels in the classroom. Nati consistently maintains a high-A average and is a member of the National Junior Honor Society.

“You will never see her without a smile on her face," RBMS Girls Coordinator Kandice Bell said. "Nati is one of the most competitive girls I have ever coached. She does not like to lose at anything!”

Congratulations to Nati Munoz, of Running Brushy Middle School, Leander ISD Student-Athlete of the Week!

post_text: Students from 10 different Leander ISD schools came together for an annual Holiday Bake event. The event is part of the expanded core curriculum and aims to promote independence in students with visual impairments. With the aid of assistive technologies like magnification applications and adapted kitchen tools, students enjoyed an afternoon of activities and holiday cheer.

post_text:
Jeff Tatum has been a volunteer at Pleasant Hill Elementary - Leander ISD for over 14 years. He is always willing to help with any task.

Tatum monitors the parking lot during the early morning hours, in the cold, in the rain, and even after evening events at the school. With safety being his number one priority, Tatum also serves as a volunteer in the school’s Watch D.O.G.S. program.

“As a parent, Jeff Tatum is a ‘Leader of the Pack,'” Principal Heather Robbins said. “He goes above and beyond for our campus. He always has a watchful eye and student safety on his mind. I have always appreciated his loyalty and support.”

Because of his unwavering dedication in service to students, Leander ISD recognizes Jeff Tatum as Volunteer of the Week. #inspireLISD Leander ISD Community Relations

post_text:
Leander ISD would like to congratulate Vista Ridge High School’s Elizabeth Clark for being named the LISD Career and Technical (CTE) Student of the Week. A senior in the Fashion Design practicum, Elizabeth is THE costume designer for the theater department, a role in which she has excelled for the last three years. Elizabeth is self-motivated, a great role model and ready and willing to try new methods!

"Elizabeth is one of the most amazing talents I have ever had the pleasure to work with; her style is whimsical and sophisticated all at once!” said advisor Amy Kranz. “Her garment line in the Annual VRHS Spring Fashion show revealed what a unique talent she has at design as well as garment construction. I know she will continue to do great things in the fashion world in the years to come. I expect to see her name in movie credits as the lead costume designer.”

post_text:
Leander ISD is proud to announce Rylie Nance, from Rouse High School, as the Leander ISD Student-Athlete of the Week. Rylie is a senior and co-captain for the Rouse Athletic Training program. Rylie has been a part of the Sports Medicine Program for four years and has maintained a drive for perfection that inspires those around her.

Even when a task is not assigned to her, Rylie will find a way to contribute. No matter how big or small the task, she takes pride in her work, no matter if it is cleaning a table or assisting with emergent injuries on the field. She also works hard to be a good teammate by leading the younger students and teaching them the skills she has learned so they can all function at a higher level.

“Since the start of my time here at Rouse, Rylie has been a “go to” Student Athletic Training Aide,” said Athletic Trainer, Miranda Gafford. “Her initiative and calm resilience, both in the athletic training room and on the field, have been important assets to us."

Congratulations to Rylie Nance, of Rouse High School, Leander ISD Student-Athlete of the Week!

post_text:
Leander ISD would like to congratulate Reagan Elementary School’s Chloe Fields for being named the LISD Fine Arts Student of the Week. Chloe, a fifth-grader, has been a Ray since she was three years old and enrolled in the ELE program. Due to a mitochondrial disorder, Chloe faces many medical issues which limit her abilities, but she loves school and Art, which allows her to interact with other kids, be creative and express herself.

She especially loves to paint and often chooses bright colors (red is her favorite). Chloe’s artwork gives her a sense of pride and accomplishment (you can tell by her smile). Art combines many important things for Chloe - friends, color and accomplishment.

“Chloe is a gift!” said art teacher Jez St. John. “She brings joy to all of us and is the heart of our school. She is famous for her artwork showcased each year at the LISD Annual Art Show. Last year the kids waited in line to swap artist trading cards with her!”

Congratulations to Reagan Rays standout Chloe Fields, the Leander ISD Fine Arts Student of the Week!

“Chloe is a gift!” said art teacher Jez St. John. “She brings joy to all of us and is the heart of our school. She is famous for her artwork showcased each year at the LISD Annual Art Show. Last year the kids waited in line to swap artist trading cards with her!”

Congratulations to Reagan Rays standout Chloe Fields, the Leander ISD Fine Arts Student of the Week!

post_text:
Leander and Vista Ridge High School's yearbook publications, The Lair and The Lonestar respectively, were recognized for excellence in design, photography, concept, coverage and writing.

The 2019 books were named Crown Award finalists from the Columbia Scholastic Press Association. This year, only 78 out of 1,145 print yearbook publications from national and international entries earned Crowns. CSPA will present Gold or Silver Crowns to each finalist in March 2020 at Columbia University. #achieveLISD

Construction on Danielson Middle School, the district's ninth middle school, is coming along nicely! Mark Koller, the school's newly announced principal, and other district staff had the chance to tour the grounds this afternoon.

This school – with a large, open common area in the middle of the campus and wings of classrooms designed for collaboration – will welcome its first batch of students during the 2020–21 school year.

Photo gallery: https://photos.leanderisd.org/2019-2020/20191121-Danielson-MS-Tour

Leander ISD added 24 new photos.
November 20, 2019 at 3:46 PM ·

The Lone Star Company Navy JROTC conducted its annual military inspection and pass-in-review Wednesday, Nov. 20, at Gupton Stadium.

Lone Star Company is led by Command Rick Hamblet. The corps of cadets is comprised of students from Vista Ridge, Rouse, Cedar Park and Vandegrift high schools.

post_text:
Terry Garity volunteers at Deer Creek Elementary. He goes above and beyond in offering teachers support.

Terry recently put his carpentry skills to use, giving his time and personal funds to build a special rotating shelf. The new shelf helps teachers organize a large collection of die-cut supplies and locate what they need easily, freeing up much-needed cabinet storage and counter-top workspace.

Because of his unwavering dedication in service to students, Leander ISD recognizes Terry Garity as Volunteer of the Week. #inspireLISD Leander ISD Community Relations

post_text:
Leander ISD would like to congratulate Vandegrift High School’s Ben Poljan for being named the LISD Career and Technical (CTE) Student of the Week. A sophomore in the Business Finance program, Ben has excelled in a leadership role, most notably in Money Matters and Business Information Management. He plans to continue through the Finance Program of Study in his upper-class years.

In Money Matters, Ben takes advantage of opportunities and is very persuasive when presenting learned content to his peers. In BIM, Ben is working toward Microsoft Office Specialist certifications in Word, PowerPoint and Excel.

“Ben took pride in his presentation and conveyed confidence in his subject matter while effectively convincing the audience to buy his banking product,” instructor Lisa Dennison said. “He shows great enthusiasm toward pursuing a career in business.”

Congratulations to Vandegrift High School’s Ben Poljan, the LISD CTE Student of the Week.

post_text: Congratulations to Leander HS and Vandegrift HS for their outstanding performances at BOA Grand Nationals in Indianapolis over the weekend! The Leander Band swept all three captions in Class 3A, was named 3A Class Champion, and finished in Fifth Place in the Finals! The Vandegrift Band swept all three captions in Class 4A, was named Class 4A Champion, won Best General Effect in the Finals, and finished as the Grand Champion!!

post_text:
Leander ISD is proud to announce Henry Middle School's Dylan Kennedy as the LISD Student-Athlete of the Week. Dylan, an 8th-grader, is a member of the Hawk football and basketball teams. Outside of athletics, Dylan is also a member of the National Junior Honor Society, Fellowship of Christian Athletes and his church youth group.

“Dylan is one of the hardest-working young men we have at HMS," Henry Middle School Boys Athletic Coordinator Craig Wes said. "He is always listening and trying to get better. Dylan is a role model for others to follow and will always impact a team no matter which sport because of his work ethic and leadership skills.”

Congrats to Dylan Kennedy, the LISD Student-Athlete of the Week!

post_text:
Superintendent Bruce Gearing, Ed.D., was selected as the 2019 recipient of the John Hoyle Leadership Award at Texas A&M's John R. Hoyle Memorial Administrative Leadership Institute on Friday. This award is given annually to an exceptional educational leader within the state of Texas.

Last week, former LISD Superintendent Tom Glenn was named among the 2019 Outstanding Alumni of the College of Education and Human Development at Texas A&M.

Glenn's legacy in Leander includes his efforts championing continuous improvement principles in public education, ably represented by his namesake, Glenn High School, which opened in 2016.

Congratulations to these deserving leaders for their accomplishments.

Leander ISD would like to congratulate Cedar Park High School’s Jackson Streit for being named the LISD Fine Arts Student of the Week. Jackson is a tenor saxophonist in the Timberwolves’ State Champion Marching Band and will be performing at Carnegie Hall in January as a finalist in the High School Performance Series.

Jackson currently serves as a leader in the band program as Assistant Logistics Officer, which requires leading by example. He also placed in District Band in the Texas All-State Music process.

“Jackson is always prepared with all music that is set before him,” CPHS Band Director Steve Wessels said. “He is an exceptional tenor saxophonist and of high morale character. He defines maturity and professionalism.

Congratulations to Cedar Park High School’s Jackson Streit, the Leander ISD Fine Arts Student of the Week.

post_text:
Isabel "Izzy" Jimenez, a fifth-grade student at Reed Elementary, is this week's #LISDSuperKid. Her "superpower" is #9 - Pursuit of Excellence.

Not one to shy away from a challenge, Isabel is constantly pushing herself to learn more in the school's Dual Language program. She is a voracious reader, checking out a new book from the Reed library almost daily.

"Izzy exemplifies what it means to be a leader," Principal Paige Collier. "She’s often seen around the school helping someone or engaged in learning."

She also serves on the Student Lighthouse Team and Safety Patrol. Isabel is a library leader and proud member of the Patriot Choir. Outside of school, she is a leader in Girl Scouts troop 1634.

Congratulations, Isabel! Thank you for being a shining example for Reed as an LISD Super Kid! #inspireLISD

post_text:
Leander ISD would like to congratulate Glenn High School’s Faith Murphy for being named the LISD Career and Technical (CTE) Student of the Week.

The junior standout is serving a second term as President of the Criminal Justice / SkillsUSA program while also serving as SkillsUSA District 10 Treasurer. Faith's contributions to the program include multiple State qualifiers, including:

-2 Felony Traffic Stop teams (placed 4th in the State)
-2 Criminal Justice Display panels (rated "Outstanding"), &
-2 District 10 officer selections.

“Faith Murphy is a model student who exemplifies all of the characteristics of a genuine professional,” instructor Bernie Acosta said. “Her selfless work ethic and leadership have contributed to multiple SkillsUSA state qualifiers in our first-year program here at Glenn High School. Faith is relentless in fulfilling her leadership obligations and her contributions have reaped many successes in our young program.”

Congratulations to Glenn High School’s Faith Murphy, the LISD CTE Student of the Week.

post_text:
Due to inclement weather conditions, Leander ISD schools will have a delayed start on Tuesday, November 12, 2019. School start times will be:

elementary schools at 9:45 a.m.,
middle schools at 10:55 a.m. and
high schools at 10:40 a.m.

Buses will run on a 2-hour delay, so if your bus normally comes at 7:45 a.m. expect it at 9:45 a.m.

Please allow extra time and use caution when traveling to your campus.

All before-school activities will be canceled, including the breakfast service.

The adjusted schedule for early childhood and pre-kindergarten programs will be:
ELE, 9:45 – 11:45
ELE, 11:45 – 1:45
E-SLE , 9:45 – 11:45
E-SLE, 9:45 – 1:00
LEIP, 9:45 – 11:45
The morning pre-school and PSLP sessions are canceled and the afternoon session will operate on a normal schedule.

The district will continue to monitor the lingering weather effects and receive updates from the National Weather Service. For the most up-to-date information, please visit the district's alerts page or follow us on social media.

post_text:
Leander ISD is mindful of the weather conditions and how the falling temperatures and precipitation may impact the school day tomorrow. We will be monitoring the weather conditions throughout the evening and into the morning.

LISD has established processes in place for evaluating weather conditions and notifying our community if a decision is made to delay the start of school. Please visit the LISD alerts page, district social media (Facebook and Twitter) or local radio and TV stations for any late developments. We will reach out to families and staff directly if there are any changes to the normal school schedule.

We trust parents to make the best decisions for their children, so if you feel travel in your area is unsafe in the morning, we respect the decision you make for your family’s safety. Please click on this link to read more about our inclement weather protocols and how we make the appropriate determinations.

http://support.leanderisd.org/support/inclement-weather-protocol/

post_text:
Leander ISD Athletics is proud to announce Cedar Park High School’s Jack Woods as the LISD Student-Athlete of the Week.

Jack is a junior on the CPHS cross country and track teams. He led the CPHS Boys Cross Country team to a Region III Championship and also won the individual title with a time of 16:07.20! Even while excelling in cross country, Jack still finds time to be active in his church.

“Jack is a very determined and dedicated athlete,” Head CPHS Cross Country Coach Chance Edwards said. “I nominated Jack for his performances inside the classroom and out. Jack takes the time to meet with teachers to discuss his classwork to better himself as a student-athlete.”

Congratulations , Jack!

post_text:
Danielson Middle School will open for the 2020–21 school year, and the district's Purchasing department invited a group of students, staff and administrators to come give feedback on what furniture they'd like to see in the new school during a hands-on expo.

Opening a new school is a years-long undertaking, and our teams do a great job of collecting feedback all along the way.

It's simple: What kind of chairs would students prefer to sit in while they're at school? Ask them!

Rocco Rainone, a third-grade student at River Ridge Elementary, is this week's #LISDSuperKid. His "superpower" is #7 - Respect for Others.

"Rocco is a joy to have as a student and exemplifies not only this ethical principle but all the ethical principles daily," third-grade teacher Marissa Casal said.

Rocco goes above and beyond to include anyone and everyone in all activities. He's kind, respectful, loving, inclusive, and so much more. On top of being a model student to his peers, Rocco is a gifted student who participates in QUEST and PACE Math.

Congratulations, Rocco! Thank you for being a shining example for River Ridge as an LISD Super Kid! #inspireLISD

Stiles Middle School
November 6, 2019 at 7:49 AM ·

Every year we ask students to write out what they are thankful for on fall colored leaves. Our students continue to express their sincere gratitude for all of our staff members. They truly inspire us to come to work everyday dedicated to giving them our best!

post_text:
Gloria Lee has remained a dedicated volunteer at Winkley Elementary, even after her grandson moved on to middle school. She is an essential part of the Winkley library and a bright spot on campus.

“Gloria is a beautiful reminder that purpose drives community service," Principal Davina Stringer said. "Her passion for supporting our library program and Winkley students is inspiring, and her spunk and humor are a bonus!”

She lights up as students enter the library where she helps out, and She greets all the students as if they were her grandchildren. They love her and seek her out to get their "Ms. Gloria" hugs.

Because of her unwavering dedication in service to students, Leander ISD recognizes Gloria Lee as Volunteer of the Week. #inpsireLISD Leander ISD Community Relations

Leander ISD would like to congratulate Glenn High School automotive technology student Javier Pena for being named the LISD Career and Technical (CTE) Student of the Week.

The GHS senior is an active member of the school’s Skills USA/RAMS club, serving as president. He is devoted to fostering an active club, holding weekly meetings to prepare students for competition. Even more impressive, Javier is a sub campus student, driving from Glenn to Rouse for meetings and class. He is also a dedicated GHS band member.

“Javier is an amazing student, driven by his desire to learn and help others,” instructor Jason Glass said. “He is always willing to stay late to finish projects and he exudes leadership qualities.”

Congratulations to Glenn High School’s Javier Pena, the LISD CTE Student of the Week.

post_text:
Leander ISD would like to congratulate Four Points Middle School’s Madison Howard for being named the LISD Fine Arts Student of the Week. Madi is an 8th-grade member of the Majestic Dance Team.

At Four Points MS, Madi has modernized the warmup and stretch out format for the team with new ideas she's learned at workshops over the summer. She consistently searches for new ways to keep the team excited to get moving every day.

“Not only is Madi the Captain of the Majestic Dance Team, but she also trains after school, participates in competitions and workshops on the weekends, and still maintains straight As in her academic classes,” Majestics Director Kelly Mabry said. “She could have easily decided to do off-campus PE, but instead wanted to be a part of the school culture and team. I'm amazed each day by the way she interacts with her teammates and leads them with the perfect combination of knowledge and grace. I am proud to be her director and am inspired by her dedication, drive and love for the arts.”

Congratulations to Madison Howard, the LISD Fine Arts Student of the Week!

Miranda Paredes, a fifth-grade student at Pleasant Hill Elementary - Leander ISD, is this week's #LISDSuperKid. Her "superpower" is #9 - Pursuit of Excellence.

She does everything to the best of her ability and is always looking for ways to improve.

"Miranda is a wonderful student who consistently exhibits pursuit of excellence," said Lori Simpson, a fifth-grade teacher. "She goes above and beyond on her assignments in class, she is kind and respectful to her classmates, and she always has a smile. Miranda is a Leader of the Pack!"

Aside from going above and beyond in her pursuit of excellence, Miranda participates in cheerleading.

Congratulations, Miranda! Thank you for being a shining example for Pleasant Hill as an LISD Super Kid! #inspireLISD

Leander ISD would like to congratulate Leander High School’s Isha Maknojia for being named the LISD Career and Technical (CTE) Education Student of the Week. She is an active, outstanding member of the school’s Health Occupations Students of America (HOSA) club.

Isha is the current HOSA Area 1 President, past HOSA Treasurer(18-19), current President of LHS National Technical Honor Society, and was voted HOSA member of the year.

“Isha is a natural leader with a deep passion for medicine,” instructor Amber Hall said. “She strives to be a role model for all HOSA members and health science students. I hope all members of HOSA and health science see the greatness I see in Isha and work hard to be just like her.”

Congratulations to Isha Maknojia, the LISD CTE Student of the Week.

Leander ISD is proud to announce Brett Baker, from Leander Middle School, as the LISD Student-Athlete of the Week. Brett is a seventh-grade standout in football, cross country and track. Brett not only pushes himself in sports but also in the classroom by taking Pace Math and Pre-AP language arts classes.

“Brett is an amazing student-athlete,” Leander Middle School Boys Athletic Coordinator Greg Steger said. “He is always striving to be his best in athletics and in the classroom. I have had several teachers send very positive emails about his work ethic, attitude and demeanor in the classroom. I feel that Brett truly represents what we try to develop as student-athletes here at Leander Middle School.”

Congratulations, Brett!

post_text:
Superintendent Bruce Gearing, Ed.D., was selected as the 2019 recipient of the John Hoyle Leadership Award. This award is given annually to an exceptional educational leader within the state of Texas.

Hoyle award recipients hold a vision for the future where success for all is a reality, they possess an ability to lead people to consistently perform at the highest levels, they use resources in inventive and imaginative ways to support classrooms and increase student learning, their actions are based on ethical considerations, and their peers know them as individuals of integrity.

Gearing will be honored as the 2019 recipient at the John R. Hoyle Memorial Administrative Leadership Institute (ALI) awards luncheon on November 13 at The Stella Hotel in Bryan, Texas.

Gearing will be honored as the 2019 recipient at the John R. Hoyle Memorial Administrative Leadership Institute (ALI) awards luncheon on November 13 at The Stella Hotel in Bryan, Texas.

post_text:
Former Leander ISD Superintendent Tom Glenn is being named a 2019 Outstanding Alumni of the College of Education and Human Development at Texas A&M University. He is among seven alumni of the college who will be recognized at an awards ceremony at the Hilton College Station and Conference Center on Nov. 1.

Glenn received his bachelor’s degree in curriculum and instruction in 1973, followed by his master’s in educational administration in 1977. After serving in various roles in school districts in College Station and Leander, Glenn was named superintendent at Leander ISD in 1987, retiring 20 years later.

Glenn’s lasting legacies in Leander include his efforts championing continuous improvement principles in public education. He helped the district develop a reputation for excellence. A testament to his impact at Leander ISD, his namesake, Glenn High School, opened in 2016.

post_text:
Leander ISD would like to congratulate Leander High School’s Abbi Gordon for being named the Career and Technical Education (CTE) Student of the Week.

Abbi, a senior, is a founding member of the Family Career and Community Leaders of America (FCCLA) Ready Set Teach program three years ago. Serving as chapter president every year since, Abbi has been an integral part of the organization, working behind the scenes to help the organization run smoothly. She has participated in STAR events, countless community service activities and leadership meetings.

“Abbi is always finding ways to recruit members and keep FCCLA involved in our school and community,” program coordinator Shelby Kenyon said. “She truly is the best definition of a leader and a friend to others. We can’t wait to see what her future holds!”

Congratulations to Abbi Gordon, the CTE Student of the Week!

Leander ISD is fortunate to have such an engaged community writing in to share thoughts on measurements and the student experience.

Since the decision of the Board to select Superintendent Bruce Gearing, Ed.D., to join our Leander ISD family, we have committed to engaging in crucial conversations about our public schools.

The Board of Trustees and the Superintendent – the Team of 8 – will continue to work on goal setting and district vision at our next meeting, Nov. 7.

We ask for you to remain engaged in these discussions and to attend future town hall events we will be hosting across the district.

Together, as a Team of 8 working with our community, we can find solutions to meet our community’s vision for our public schools.

To view a PDF of the District Improvement Plan presentation at the Oct. 17 Board Meeting, click here: http://bit.ly/District-Improvement-Plan

Leander ISD is proud to announce Leander High School’s Emma Stauber as the LISD Student-Athlete of the Week. Emma is a senior on the Lady Lion Varsity Volleyball team.

As a team captain, Emma leads her team as a top contributor on and off the court. In addition to being a top student, Emma is a member of the Fellowship of Christian Athletes, Spanish National Honor Society, and an International Baccalaureate Ambassador. In her spare time, she volunteers with multiple programs at her local church.

“Emma always gives 100% on the court and puts her teammates first at all times,” LHS Head Volleyball coach Ashley Atkinson said. “She has a huge heart for her team and for the sport of volleyball. She is a wonderful leader, athlete and human.”

Leander ISD is proud to announce Leander Middle School theatre standout Sydney Gillen as the LISD Fine Arts Student of the Week.Sydney, an 8th-grader, has been an active member of the LMS Theatre program for three years. Her acting resume includes roles as Blackstache in "Peter and the Star Catcher," Harry Bailey in "It's a Wonderful Life” and Ethel Savage in "The Curious Savage'.

Sydney takes multiple pre-AP courses and is a member of the LMS volleyball and cross country teams. She truly exemplifies the LMS motto, "Enter to Learn. Exit to Lead."

“Sydney's contributions to not only the Theatre Arts Department but also the campus are invaluable,” said LMS Theatre Director Dana Thompson. “She is an exemplary student leader and positively impacts every organization in which she is involved. We are beyond grateful for her the impact she has made here at LMS.”

Congratulations to Sydney Gillen, the Leander ISD Fine Arts Student of the Week!

post_text:
It is #NationalSchoolLunchWeek, and Leander ISD is celebrating the occasion with the launch of mobile ordering at all of LISD's six high schools! The district had the opportunity to collaborate with the state to bring this innovative ordering process to LISD students. Students can select items from the Mobile-Exclusive Menu and order via the free Nutrislice App or go to leanderisd.nutrislice.com to order from a desktop.

Mobile Ordering Instructions
-Download the free Nutrislice app or go to leanderisd.nutrislice.com to order online.
-Select “Mobile Ordering,” then select your campus.
-Select either “Menus Available for Ordering” or “All Menus,” depending on what you would like to view. Available dates are underlined in blue.
-Then, build your lunch!
-Check out by logging into an existing account OR sign up if you don’t have one already.
-Select the pick-up period & grab it to-go during lunch!
text:
It is #NationalSchoolLunchWeek, and Leander ISD is celebrating the occasion with the launch of mobile ordering at all of LISD's six high schools! The district had the opportunity to collaborate with the state to bring this innovative ordering process to LISD students. Students can select items from the Mobile-Exclusive Menu and order via the free Nutrislice App or go to leanderisd.nutrislice.com to order from a desktop.

Mobile Ordering Instructions
-Download the free Nutrislice app or go to leanderisd.nutrislice.com to order online.
-Select “Mobile Ordering,” then select your campus.
-Select either “Menus Available for Ordering” or “All Menus,” depending on what you would like to view. Available dates are underlined in blue.
-Then, build your lunch!
-Check out by logging into an existing account OR sign up if you don’t have one already.
-Select the pick-up period & grab it to-go during lunch!

post_text:
Garrett Stacey is investing in the next generation in a powerful way. For two years now, Garrett has mentored fourth and fifth-grade boys at Knowles Elementary.

He has been a consistent positive role model for students by developing meaningful relationships to help activate their potential.

"Growing up today is a lot different than years past. Many kids feel stress from society and school," Principal Lara Labbe-Maginel said. "Garrett has been an encourager and support to some of our students that just needed a little more support. He is always positive and encouraging and reliable for these students."

Garrett also tries to take care of teachers. About three times a year, he sends trays of cookies for the teachers with a letter of encouragement simply thanking teachers for all they do for students.

Because of his unwavering dedication in service to students, Leander ISD recognizes Garrett Stacey as Volunteer of the Week. #inspireLISD Leander ISD Community Relations

post_text:
Leander ISD is proud to announce Vista Ridge High School senior Canon Kromis as the LISD Student-Athlete of the Week. Canon is a senior member of the Ranger varsity football, baseball, and track & field teams.

Canon currently serves as a captain on the football team and is on the football Leadership Council. In addition to his achievements in athletics, Canon is a straight-A student that excels in the classroom.

“Canon is a relentless worker who strives for greatness in everything he does,” said Head Football Coach Rodney Vincent. “He’s always willing to go above and beyond, and is a true leader at Vista Ridge High School.”

Congratulations to Canon Kromis, from Vista Ridge High School, the LISD Student-Athlete of the Week.

post_text:
Leander ISD is proud to announce Leander High School choir standout Madison Cook as the Fine Arts Student of the Week. Madison, a junior, has been in the Leander Choir for three years. During this time, she has been a member of the TMEA Region choir, a choir council representative, show choir dance captain and choir vice president.

Madison is a member of two varsity ensembles, Lionheart and Leander Legacy Show Choir, and she is expanding her music knowledge by taking AP Music Theory. Outside of the classroom, Madison is an accompanist and piano teacher and on student council.

"Madison gives her best during every rehearsal,” said LHS Choir Director Chrissy Williams. “She works with her peers in a positive way that helps us reach new goals. She is a wonderful role model and she never lets a challenge stop her from achieving. Our choir is lucky to have someone so willing to lend a helping hand."

Congratulations to Madison Cook, the Leander ISD Fine Arts Student of the Week!

post_text:
Olivia Miller, a fifth-grade student at Laura Welch Bush Elementary, is this week's #LISDSuperKid. Her "superpower" is #5 - Concern for Others.

Olivia is an incredible friend to all. No matter the day, situation or mood, she will drop what she is doing to help others. The epitome of inclusivity, it's second nature for Olivia to work to make those around her joyful and successful. Teachers and students can always rely on Olivia to do the right thing and stand up for herself and those around her, both inside and outside the classroom.

"Olivia lights up the room and is a delight to teach and learn from," Teacher Ann Scott said. "She is a hard-worker who balances many things, including taking time to help others. She is a natural leader, leading with grace and positivity each and every day."

Olivia also participates in flag football on the "Texans" team, is a member of Heart 2 Heart, a 5th-grade girls' group, and is a QUEST student.

Congratulations, Olivia! Thank you for being a shining example for Bush as an LISD Super Kid! #inspireLISD

post_text:
Katy Leal is a jack of all trades. She is a PTA Board Parliamentarian and volunteers as a Teacher Workroom Committee Lead at Larkspur Elementary. She leads the volunteer group that meets weekly to help teachers in the workroom by laminating, cutting materials, and anything the teachers need.

"Katy is dedicated to making our school look great, making sure our teachers are taken care of and feel loved and supported," Principal Tracie Montanio said. "She is willing to step in to get anything done and has great ideas!"

Katy's strong work ethic drives her to work hard and make sure things aren't just done, but done well. At times even with her toddler in tow, she is setting the example for her family on the rewarding experience of giving back to her community. The smile on her face reflects her excitement to be at Larkspur and be a part of a strong PTA.

Because of her unwavering dedication in service to students, Leander ISD recognizes Katy Leal as Volunteer of the Week. #inspireLISD Leander ISD Community Relations

post_text:
Leander ISD is proud to announce Leander High School’s Daniel Guerrero as the Career and Technical Education (CTE) Student of the Week. Daniel is a senior in the Air Force Junior ROTC program and serves as the Fall 2019 Cadet Corps Commander, leading the Color Guard and the LHS flag detail. He has also served as a flight commander and operations noncommissioned officer in charge. Daniel is working to boost freshman participation in the Corps and to reinvigorate its drill, rocketry and fitness teams.

“Daniel is a great leader who is dedicated to his fellow cadets,” said program director Jeff Moffitt. “It has been a pleasure watching him grow into his leadership roles.”

Congratulations to Daniel Guerrero, the Leander ISD CTE Student of the Week!

The district's annual Festival of Bands took place, Monday, Oct. 7, at Gupton Stadium in Leander.

The event featured all LISD high school marching bands and auxiliaries in exhibition marching performances as well as an exciting combined finale performance featuring all eight middle schools and six high schools. Congratulations to these talented students and staff members on excellent performances.

To view the complete photo album and high-resolution versions, check out https://photos.leanderisd.org/2019-2020/20191007-Festival-of-Bands/

Leander ISD is proud to announce Canyon Ridge Middle School’s Evan Ragsdale as the Leander ISD Student-Athlete of the Week.

Evan is an eighth-grade standout on the Eagle football, basketball, and track & field teams. In addition to his time in athletics, Evan is also a member of the Canyon Ridge varsity choir.

“Evan is an exceptionally talented athlete who embodies the Canyon Ridge Middle School Athletic hallmarks of team, discipline, and winning,” Boys Athletic Coordinator Seth Simmons said. “He is a great teammate and friend with outstanding character. He leads not only with his voice, but with his actions.”

Congratulations to Evan Ragsdale, the Leander ISD Student-Athlete of the Week!

post_text:
Trustees continued the discussion on the ideal school size. Several factors impact school sizes, such as programming in middle and high schools and the optimal size for non-classroom spaces. As LISD continues to support rapid growth in portions of the district, there will also need to be continued discussion on building utilization, based on the utilization of schools ranging from 54% to 105% at elementary schools.

Presentation at -> http://bit.ly/lisdschoolsize

post_text:
The special education and special programs teams finished a five-part series of presentations about programs for serving various learners receiving an intervention, 504 or special education services.

“In my heart, I truly believe we are doing good things,” Trustee Jim MacKay said. “ We have a talented and educated special education program. We also have a room full of parents that are screaming for inclusion. I'm just trying to get my head around the disconnect between what we think we're doing, what some of the community think we are not doing and how do we bring this together. At the end of the day, it's about including all of our students and setting each and every student up for success.”

Staff is collaborating with a Building the Bridge group, comprised of parents and community partners to help develop programming for children in special education. The district is working towards a symposium to engage the community, discuss shortcomings and work to find solutions.

See entire presentation -> http://bit.ly/lisd504pres

post_text:
Leander ISD congratulates Cedar Park High School senior Faith Elliot for being named the LISD Fine Arts Student of the Month. The standout photographer started #Projectfriendship - a drive to make friendship bracelets for school children before she travels back to Rwanda next month. Her photographs from Rwanda last year won the PTA Reflections contest, the Scholastic Art and Writing Award, and earned her AP/college credit!

“Faith is a remarkable young woman, a true global citizen,” said CPHS Art and Photography teacher Tiffany Asha. “She is dedicated to the betterment of humanity, and using her art to help others.”

Congratulations to Faith Elliot, from Cedar Park High School, the Leander ISD CTE Student of the Week!

Lauren Blanton, a fifth-grade student at Cox Elementary School, is this week's #LISDSuperKid. Her "superpower" is #7 - Respect for Others, though she's been known to wield other superpowers too - Honesty, Civic Duty, and Pursuit of Excellence.

Lauren is a positive role model for all students and always goes out of her way to support her peers.

"It's my pleasure to have Lauren at the campus," Principal Charlie Rodriguez said. "She is always smiling and has a positive attitude. I enjoy seeing her in the hallways and giving her high fives. She truly is an amazing student. I've known her for two years, and she always goes above and beyond to help others."

Lauren is active in her school as she participates in the Cox Choir, Run Club, and she also loves to swim.

Congratulations, Lauren! Thank you for being a shining example for Cox as an LISD Super Kid!

post_text:
Some say Anna Smith, PTA Board Member, lives at Wiley Middle School. Although she doesn't have a student at Wiley this year, she continues to volunteer and offer a lending hand for all activities.

"Anna is amazing! She works to make sure every voice is heard!" Principal Brandon Evans said.

Anna has a "get it done" attitude that drives her to help everyone or anyone that needs it. Her impact has extended well beyond fundraising and school dances. As an advocate for all children, she was instrumental in the creation of an inclusion committee at Wiley to ensure all children feel welcome at school.

Because of her unwavering dedication in service to students, Leander ISD recognizes Anna Smith as Volunteer of the Week. #inspireLISD Leander ISD Community Relations

Leander ISD is proud to announce Glenn High School's Chloe Coffee as the Leander ISD Student-Athlete of the week. Chloe is a junior on the Glenn Grizzly varsity volleyball and varsity track and field teams.

In addition to her commitments in athletics and academics, Chloe is a member of the National Honor Society, Student Council and Future Farmers of America.

"Chloe is a great leader, who is passionate and coachable," GHS Volleyball Coach Melissa Rich said. "She’s disciplined and excels in the classroom and on the court.”

Congratulations to Chloe Coffee, the Leander ISD Student-Athlete of the Week!

post_text:
Our students shined on a BIG stage. Congratulations to our 5 high schools, who finished top 10 at the Austin Bands of America Regional contest.

The accolades include Vandegrift High School, who earned the competition’s top score across all divisions, including overall outstanding music performance and overall outstanding music effect.

The Leander High School Band also finished as the contest’s overall outstanding visual performance.

Reigning 6A state UIL champion Vista Ridge finished no. 3 in the AAAA division.

Reigning UIL 5A state champion Cedar Park finished no. 2 in the AAA division.

Rouse made the BOA regional finals for the first time in school history. Congratulations to all of our outstanding students.

post_text:
In past years, students who performed at a qualifying level on their PSAT, SAT, ACT, etc. were allowed to use this score to substitute for one or more of their STAAR End of Course (EOC) exams. Per the U.S. Dept. of Education, this policy has changed for this school year, 2019-2020.

If a student is currently enrolled in one or more of the following courses: Algebra I, English I, English II, Biology, and US History, the student is REQUIRED to take the corresponding STAAR EOC exam. This decision was made by the U.S. Dept. of Education and was shared with school districts by the Commissioner of Education, Mike Morath. Commissioner's letter

Please reach out to your child’s teacher or visit the LISD Knowledge Base for more information.

http://support.leanderisd.org/support/2019-20-changes-to-use-of-substitute-assessments/

Attention students! Throughout this school year, we will offer topics and prompts for you to share your thoughts with the superintendent. Using ThoughtExchange, users respond to a question and then rate responses from other users. This online survey tool is confidential and transparent.

Our prompt for September is: Message for Dr. Gearing

Bruce Gearing has joined Leander ISD as Superintendent of Schools. The Superintendent oversees all schools in Leander ISD. Please share something you enjoy about your school or classroom, or something you’d like to change.

Please share your thoughts at www.leanderisd.org/studentvoice by Sunday at midnight.

post_text:
LISD is hosting a Parenting the Love and Logic Way® course.

Parenting the Love and Logic Way® is a six-week course designed to help parents nurture responsible, respectful children who will learn to make their own choices and think critically and logically for themselves, while parents let empathy and consequences do the teaching.

The course is appropriate for parents with any aged child and any situation: home, school or even work. You do not need to have a child in Leander ISD to attend – anyone is welcome.

Fall 2019 Class information:
Canyon Ridge Middle School – Library Conference Room
12601 Country Trails, Austin, 78732
November 7, 14, 21 and December 5, 12, and 19, 2019
10–12 P.M. or 6–8 P.M.

Leander ISD would like to congratulate Rouse High School's Kyleigh Simpson for being named the LISD Fine Arts Student of the Week.

The senior Rouse Royal dance team member is currently serving the team as social officer and has shown outstanding commitment to the standards to which the troupe holds itself. A three-year standout for the Royals, Kyleigh leads by example and is primed to make her final campaign with the dance team her best yet.

“Kyleigh is the ideal Royal who is always working hard on her dance technique while constantly thinking of new ways to build spirit and sisterhood within the program,” Royals director Amy McKee said. “She is an asset to the team and I'm very proud of her work ethic and enthusiasm for her team.”

Congratulations to Kyleigh Simpson of Rouse High School, the Leander ISD Fine Arts Student of the Week!

post_text:
Joey Losurdo, a fourth-grade student at Naumann Elementary, is this week's LISD Super Kid. His "superpower" is #5 - Concern for Others. Joey goes above and beyond in his academics but also when it comes to putting others before himself.

"Joey shows leadership skills and a passion for helping others," teacher Bridgette Shackelford said. "He is a great example of the students in Leander ISD."

Recently, Joey got caught being kind. He heard that a student was upset because a specific book was unavailable at school. Joey went out of his way to go home, find the book, and bring it back to school for him. Besides being an awesome kid, Joey plays football and participates in Quest and Pace math.

Congratulations, Joey! Thank you for being a shining example for Naumann as an LISD Super Kid! #inspireLISD #LISDSuperKid

post_text:
Leander ISD would like to congratulate Vista Ridge High School senior Kiidiyah Martin-Maner for being named the LISD Career and Technical Education (CTE) Student of the Month.

Kiidiyah is thriving in the VRHS ACCELeratorEDU entrepreneurship program, having received funding after a successful program inception last year via INCubatorEDU.

Kiidiyah and her mother, an LISD bus driver, moved to Killeen this past summer. The two leave home at 5 a.m. every day so Kiidiyah can ride to Cedar Park with her mother when she drives her bus routes and still attend Vista Ridge and do the INCubator program.

"Kiidiyah's company, NoNo Zone, LLC, received funding as a result of her team's hard work and looks poised for continued success now that it is funded," said program coordinator Dana Jones. "It's a pleasure watching Kiidiyah and her fellow students flourish in this program and create solutions and a business at the same time."

Congratulations to Kiidiyah Martin-Maner of Vista Ridge High School, the Leander ISD CTE Student of the Week!

post_text:
REMINDER! The LISD College Fair is from 6–8 p.m. THIS Wednesday, Sept. 25, at Vista Ridge High School.

Students will have the opportunity to meet with representatives from four-year and two-year colleges and universities, trade schools and technical programs, and the armed services.

Parking is at Gupton Stadium, and college representatives will be in the cafeteria and competition gym. Breakout sessions will take place in the multi-purpose room.

Register in advance to spend more time getting the information you need from the schools that interest you and less time filling out forms.

How to Register:

-Go to www.gotocollegefairs.com
-Click on Register
-Select Texas
-Choose TACRAO for the week of Sept. 23 in Central Texas
-Complete the required information, and print your barcode
-Don't forget to bring your barcode to the college fair

Leander ISD is proud to announce Derek Landry, from Running Brushy Middle School, as the LISD Student-Athlete of the Week. Derek is a 7th-grade member of the Cougar football team and plans to try out for the basketball team this fall as well. In addition to his role in athletics, Derek participates in a leadership course and finds he is able to apply what he learns in the classroom to the football field.

“Derek has been working hard in practice and gets better every day,” said RBMS 7th-grade coach Brandon Hopp. “He excels in the classroom and is a true leader in the 7th-grade athletic program.”

Congratulations to Running Brushy Middle School’s Derek Landry, the Leander ISD Student-Athlete of the Week!

text:
The next stop on the #1LISD tour with new Superintendent Bruce Gearing was to Glenn High School. On display was the culinary class, a science class, the shop, and much much more!

We also squeezed in a trip across the street to the school's newest addition, an Ag Barn, part of the district's 2017 Bond package. Thanks to Mr. Coffee for showing off this beautiful new facility!

post_text: The #1LISD tour rolled on to Plain Elementary, where new Superintendent Bruce Gearing had his temperature taken at the clinic by Nurse Bucko, he “made his mark” by coloring a dot, and he jumped in the action during a performing arts class of kindergarten students.

post_text: We had a great group of #1LISD campus visits Friday with new Superintendent Bruce Gearing, starting with Bagdad Elementary, one of the district's four dual-language schools. Lunch with 5th-graders is always a great way to end the week!

post_text:
Save the date! LISD students and parents are encouraged to attend the district’s College Fair from 6–8 p.m. Wednesday, Sept. 25, at Vista Ridge High School (200 S. Vista Ridge Blvd. in Cedar Park) to learn more about admissions, financial aid and scholarships to prepare for students' collegiate endeavors.

Students will have the opportunity to meet with representatives from four-year and two-year colleges and universities, trade schools and technical programs. Additionally, the armed services will be represented.

Parking is at Gupton Stadium, and college representatives will be in the cafeteria and competition gym. Breakout sessions will take place in the multi-purpose room.

Register in advance to spend more time getting the information you need from the schools that interest you and less time filling out forms.

How to Register:

-Go to www.gotocollegefairs.org
-Click on Register
-Select Texas
-Choose TACRAO for the week of Sept. 23 in Central Texas
-Complete the required information, and print your barcode
-Don't forget to bring your barcode to the college fair

post_text:
Leander ISD is proud to announce Leander High School Choir standout Ethan Grinstead as the LISD Fine Arts Student of the Week.

Ethan is in both the top Lionheart Mixed Choir and also the Chamber Choir, and has made the TMEA All-Region Choir the last two years. He regularly attends camps and sectionals, and has served as section leader as well. He knows how to build relationships not only with the members of his sections and ensemble, but also people from the entire choral program at Leander.

"We love seeing Ethan take initiative during sectionals, as well as how his teammates respond and look up to him," said LHS Choir Director Rob Saldana. "We are very blessed to have him in our program."

Congratulations to Leander High School's Ethan Grinstead, the LISD Fine Arts Student of the Week!

Thank you to the student leaders at Deer Creek Elementary for showing new Superintendent Bruce Gearing around the school during his #1LISD tour. QUEST students were setting goals, and the 1st and 2nd graders we saw were engaged in their learning!

Ms. Price's 1st Grade class had quite the surprise welcome with each student holding up photo cutouts of Dr. Gearing's face.

post_text:
As Fine Arts Booster Club Secretary, Becky Brumley helps provide support to directors and students in the Fine Arts programs at Glenn High School by fundraising and coordinating volunteers for events.

Brumley volunteers every week. She always has a smile and does anything and everything for the Grizzly Band.

"Ms. Brumley has been here since day one and has helped in so many different ways," Glenn Principal Arturo Lomeli said.

Because of her unwavering dedication in service to students, Leander ISD recognizes Becky Brumley as Volunteer of the Week. #inspire LISD Leander ISD Community Relations
